result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Attempted Burglary-Building or Dwelling as repeater

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 02-12-16.

Defendant in custody.   
State moves to dismiss and read in this file, the defendant entered pleas in Case Files 15 CF 543 and 15 CF 525.   Motion granted.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
The defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY AND NOT GUILTY BY REASON OF MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT.  The Court will appoint an examiner.  Further dates will be scheduled once the report is received.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  The matter is continued for a preliminary hearing on 09-01-15 at 10:30 a.m.  The $2,000.00 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the court and the defendant is released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information with in 24 hours and have no contact with the Rahr West Museum.
Bail furnished.
